availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Or 2390: Sidur are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal page for usage details, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. Irrespective of its copyright status, items and/or collections should not be altered or used in ways that might be derogatory to the originating individuals or communities. (Please follow the link for the complete text of the BL Ethical Terms of Use)

notesStmt.note: Lacuna after folio 52. Folios 113-118 originally belonged to another manuscript of about the same date. Folios 111, 112, 119-124 are a recent addition. Water-damaged.

Maimon ben Se῾adya᾿ ben Mosheh Al-Musa᾿i (patron): inscribed, folio 110v.Folios 111-112: a calendar for the 286th and 287th cycle, followed by the series of prognostications based on the date of the teḳufot.Folios 113-118: originally a part of another manuscript: several poetical pieces and additional blessings.Folios 119r-123r: originally belonging to a different manuscript of approximately 18th century: additional prayers.Folios 122v-123r: tiḳunim.Folios 123v-124r: a table with a 292th cycle.Folio 2r: partly illegible piece similar to Kol nidre.Folio 2v: a poetical piece.Folio 3r: three additional prayers.Folio 4r: an additional prayer and the beginning of Kol nidre. Zekhariah ben Daṿid: inscribed with his name in a note, folio 1v. Avraham ben Shalom: inscribed, folio 2r.Folio 124r: two records of sale, dated 1797 and 1811 respectively.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A service book according to the Yemenite rite.

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, signed at the beginning and at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script, punctuated, of the 17th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Prayer Book. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2390.'
